learning.unsupervised

Class ClustererFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • learning.unsupervised.ClustererFactory

  • public class ClustererFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to fetch the initial parametrizations of various clustering method objects within the evaluation framework.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClustererFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<ClusteringAlg> getAllClusterers(DataSet dset, int k, float[][] distMat, NeighborSetFinder nsf, float[][] trainingKernelMat, NeighborSetFinder nsfKernel, int nClust, CombinedMetric cmet, Kernel ker)
      This method generates all supported clusterers representing different algorithms, for the given data.
      static ClusteringAlg getClustererForName(java.lang.String cName, DataSet dset, int k, float[][] distMat, NeighborSetFinder nsf, float[][] trainingKernelMat, NeighborSetFinder nsfKernel, int nClust, CombinedMetric cmet, Kernel ker)
      This is how initial clusterer instances are currently generated, as they require initial parametrizations and doing all of that via reflection in every single case might be somewhat non-trivial in the general case - though it is certainly preferable to having the algorithm names hardcoded inside.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getClustererForName

        public static ClusteringAlg getClustererForName(java.lang.String cName,
                                DataSet dset,
                                int k,
                                float[][] distMat,
                                NeighborSetFinder nsf,
                                float[][] trainingKernelMat,
                                NeighborSetFinder nsfKernel,
                                int nClust,
                                CombinedMetric cmet,
                                Kernel ker)
        This is how initial clusterer instances are currently generated, as they require initial parametrizations and doing all of that via reflection in every single case might be somewhat non-trivial in the general case - though it is certainly preferable to having the algorithm names hardcoded inside. TODO: change this clusterer initialization mechanism.
        Parameters:
        cName - Clusterer name.
        dset - DataSet object.
        k - Neighborhood size.
        distMat - Distance matrix.
        nsf - NeighborSetFinder object for kNN sets.
        trainingKernelMat - Kernel matrix.
        nsfKernel - Kernel kNN object.
        numClusters - Number of clusters.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.
        ker - Kernel object for kernel mappings.
        Returns:

      • getAllClusterers

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ClusteringAlg> getAllClusterers(DataSet dset,
                                                  int k,
                                                  float[][] distMat,
                                                  NeighborSetFinder nsf,
                                                  float[][] trainingKernelMat,
                                                  NeighborSetFinder nsfKernel,
                                                  int nClust,
                                                  CombinedMetric cmet,
                                                  Kernel ker)
        This method generates all supported clusterers representing different algorithms, for the given data. It can be used in unit testing.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet object.
        k - Neighborhood size.
        distMat - Distance matrix.
        nsf - NeighborSetFinder object for kNN sets.
        trainingKernelMat - Kernel matrix.
        nsfKernel - Kernel kNN object.
        numClusters - Number of clusters.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.
        ker - Kernel object for kernel mappings.
        Returns:
